title: FS: Three C.1890's Kimball Studio Saint Paul’s School Hockey CDV's
author: jb217676

posts.post_title: FS: Three C.1890's Kimball Studio Saint Paul’s School Hockey CDV's
posts.post_content:
Hi everyone,

Available for sale are three CDV's by the Kimball Studio in Concord, New Hampshire, (which is from a collection that features quite possibly the first American ice hockey cards to feature uniformed players on skates). They feature unidentified players from the Saint Paul’s School in New Hampshire, which makes a claim to having hosted the first ice hockey game in the United States on November 17, 1883.

SGC has authenticated the cards but was unable to directly identify the players and believes they date to the 1890's. Early hockey cards of this nature are EXTREMELY RARE. Where CDVs exist, they most often show players out of uniform in street clothes. The CDV's have some writing and scrap book residue on the reverse but are in beautiful condition otherwise! PM or post if interested and thanks for looking.

Price is "SOLD". Prices include shipping, tracking & insurance from Canada.
I know someone here loves hockey (besides me). Let's make a deal on the three!

How about "SOLD" for all three CDV's including delivery. That is a fantastic deal and as low as I'll go on these beauties!
Jeff
